    private class GameIO.BoardDisplay
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Internal class containing the JFrame, its elements and their behaviour

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoardDisplay(int size)
      Overloaded constructor which takes the size n of our to be constructed board Initializes and places various needed variables/elements and automatic resizing of gameelements

      • placeElements

        private void placeElements()
        Creates all visual gameelements by calling the corresponding init methods if the board wasnt already constructed and places/scales them accordingly after that and on subsequent calls. Sites are placed starting from the bottom row up. Sites normally have an upper left, upper right and horizontal link(to the right neighbor), A Link is placed using the center of its originating Site and the center of its secondary Site as reference points. The O represents the originating Site: \ / O _ Exceptions to this based on the desired board shape are detected and skipped, that includes:
        • Right border horizontal links
        • Top border upper left/right links
        • Left border upper left links above the center row
        They are places one Layer behind our constructed Sites.

      • addLabelListener

        private void addLabelListener(javax.swing.JLabel label,
                              java.lang.String name)
        Adds a Label to our panel and sets a corresponding action listener for move construction, attaches the wanted string to the action (surrender, but other predefined moves would be possible)
        Parameters:

        name - parsable string to attach
